Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: Aussietiourist
Reviews.Content: This motel is surprising for its price and location. Rooms ar quite spacious, well appointed [small tele though] and clean for the price. Desk service was efficient although some questions of surrounding services and amenities were unable to be answered, clearly their world opens and closes at the front door. Easy walk to local rail services into city centre and very suprisingly quiet for a motel so close to major roadway and the airport flight path. Will stay there again in the future. Paid $134 per night per couple.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel started off well until...”
Reviews.Author: Beckydu
Reviews.Content: This hotel appeared to be good value for money. However, since we've left we have realised a very expensive torch we had is missing. The only reason we took it out of our car was so that it would not get stolen. We contacted the hotel the afternoon we left and asked them to search the room. They have told us that it is not there. We don't have it, they claim it hasn't been found so the only explanation is that it was taken at some stage during our stay. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Not huge luxury but great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: frankiemac28
Reviews.Content: The Garden Lodge Hotel was superb value for money. Only 5 minute walk to Metro station....into town 10 minutes. Room Wi-Fi the best quality (5 bar) I have ever had in years. Fox Sports channels for free. Staff extremely pleasant and helpful. Seen a couple of bland reviews online. Probably from rich idiots obviously used to staying in huge luxury Hotels which would cost twice to three times this cost. Good quality rooms, not hugely luxurious but with the earlier mentioned great positives this Hotel is an 8-9 out of 10. If I came back to Sydney yes I would stay here again. Frankie Mac

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Jarex26
Reviews.Content: What a surprise this accommodation was, not knowing the outer suburbs of Sydney we booked this and really didn't know what to expect , I thought it might be a bit dodgy but as my title says "pleasantly surprised". We paid $119 for the night and was definitely value for money. Staff were very good, rooms basic but clean and comfortable. My husband was impressed with information and services provided such as the hotel room guide giving details on getting around or finding the closest restaurant . One tip from the hotel guide was how not to be taken advantage $$ buy taxi drivers, if the taxi driver doesn't now how to get to your designation quickly insist they use the GPS. Well done to the staff and Management . We will not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room. Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: SilverProdigy
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel due to its proximity to ANZ stadium and based on previous reviews. The rooms were spacious and clean. They were service daily. The only annoyance was the shower did not have doors. This meant that whenever you have a shower, the entire bathroom would get wet. The hotel has one washing machine and dryer free of use for guests. We were impressed with the friendliness of the staff. I probably won't recommend this for tourists wishing to see the main sites of Sydney, eg. Opera House, Harbour bridge, etc. unless you have a car. There is a nearby train station which is around a 10 minute walk. However, for similar price you should be able to obtain accomodation closer in to the Sydney CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nina J
Reviews.Content: This place is okay. by okay i mean, i got just what i paid for. nothing more. Would recommend for business people.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay With our 20 Months Old Daughter”
Reviews.Author: AnnyKhan
Reviews.Content: I was scred when i booked this place but this is best Place i loved It its 5 Minutes walk from Train Station I recommend this place and whenever i go sydney from canada i will love to stay there again i really like the Manager he is Very Nice and he knows how to deal with His Customers :) I was very happy with our stay we lived the for about week :)

Reviews.Title: “OK Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: HarryPotterFinal
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find. The staff members were friendly. This hotel was located a bit far away from the shopping cenre. But as long as you have a car, there should be no problem. Although I rated this hotel 'average', but no doubt it's value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great price”
Reviews.Author: mel_250685
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews i was getting very worried about staying here, my friends and I wanted somewhere we could stay for a night and EVERYWHERE was just about booked out, until i came across this one, this was $160 for the night for 5 people, this work out to be $30 each, the room was Great and the beds were VERY comfortable, with aircon, LCD screen and bathroom... was not at all expecting the room to be good, this is newly renovated and you could tell everything was new... the staff were great and very helpful, The only down fall was the located.. the area is not very nice... however it only costed $20 taxi ride to the city!! i would highly recommend staying here if your planning a night out and don't want to pay $300 bucks a night, Free parking!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel, is pretty crap”
Reviews.Author: steveofcanberra
Reviews.Content: Well lets be honest. This hotel is cheap. I killed about 5 cockroaches about the size of my thumb scurrying across the bedroom floor, and wondered if they would lay eggs in my inner ear while I slept. The driveway is dangerous to get out of onto Parramatta rd, and the coffee provided in the room was International Roast, which all Aussies know, is the foulest poison to ever fall under the coffee banner. I would recommend this place if: If your young and need a cheap place to sleep, If you just broke up with your wife and are living out of your car, If you are living on the streets and have gathered enough coins from singing 'Sweet Home Alabama' on the pavement on George Street, and want to lay your head on something slightly more hygenic than a dead rat. Never, ever again will I stay there.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: shazammelbourne
Reviews.Content: If you need a motel for under $100 a night not too far from Sydney CBD, this qualifies. But this is really basic with no trimmings at all. I arrived after driving straight through from Melbourne, and the air conditioner, jug and television were all not working. And the bathroom had no plug. I complained (mildly) at the front desk but the woman made it clear nothing would be done that evening. The rooms have no windows- just a small balcony overlooking the incredibly noisy street- and the room got quite stuffy until the a/c was fixed the next day. A railway station is only a 10 minute walk away which is handy, but when driving out of the motel you only have a left turn and it's quite a performance to get the car pointed towards Liverpool and beyond. All in all, very average and I never got the plug.

HotelInfo.Name: Garden Lodge Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 17 Parramatta Rd | Haberfield, Sydney, New South Wales 2045, Australia
